generic.label: How to host virtual coffee breaks with n8n
Supercharging your conference registration process with n8n
15 Google apps you can combine and automate to increase productivity
Hey founders! Your business doesn't need you to operate
5 workflow automation for Mattermost that we love at n8n
Tracking Time Spent in Meetings With Google Calendar, Twilio, and n8n

properties.name: calendar
properties.description: Google Calendar to operate on

properties.name: start
properties.description: Start time of the event

properties.name: end
properties.description: End time of the event

properties.name: additionalFields
properties.description: Whether the event is all day or not

options.name: allday
options.description: Whether the event is all day or not

options.name: attendees
options.description: The attendees of the event. Multiple ones can be separated by comma.

options.name: color
options.description: The color of the event. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

options.name: conferenceDataUi
options.description: Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression

values.name: conferenceSolution
values.description: Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression

options.name: guestsCanInviteOthers
options.description: Whether attendees other than the organizer can invite others to the event

options.name: guestsCanModify
options.description: Whether attendees other than the organizer can modify the event

options.name: guestsCanSeeOtherGuests
options.description: Whether attendees other than the organizer can see who the event's attendees are

options.name: id
options.description: Opaque identifier of the event

options.name: location
options.description: Geographic location of the event as free-form text

options.name: maxAttendees
options.description: The maximum number of attendees to include in the response. If there are more than the specified number of attendees, only the participant is returned.

options.name: rrule
options.description: Recurrence rule. When set, the parameters Repeat Frequency, Repeat How Many Times and Repeat Until are ignored.

options.name: sendUpdates
options.description: Notifications are sent to all guests

options.name: All
options.description: Notifications are sent to all guests

options.name: External Only
options.description: Notifications are sent to non-Google Calendar guests only

options.name: None
options.description: No notifications are sent. This value should only be used for migration use case.

options.name: showMeAs
options.description: The event does not block time on the calendar

options.name: Available
options.description: The event does not block time on the calendar

options.name: Busy
options.description: The event does block time on the calendar

options.name: summary
options.description: Title of the event

options.name: visibility
options.description: The event is private. This value is provided for compatibility reasons.

options.name: Confidential
options.description: The event is private. This value is provided for compatibility reasons.

options.name: Default
options.description: Uses the default visibility for events on the calendar

options.name: Private
options.description: The event is private and only event attendees may view event details

options.name: Public
options.description: The event is public and event details are visible to all readers of the calendar

properties.description: If the event doesn't use the default reminders, this lists the reminders specific to the event

properties.name: options
properties.description: The maximum number of attendees to include in the response. If there are more than the specified number of attendees, only the participant is returned.

options.name: maxAttendees
options.description: The maximum number of attendees to include in the response. If there are more than the specified number of attendees, only the participant is returned.

options.displayName: Return Next Instance of Recurring Event
options.name: returnNextInstance
options.description: Whether to return the next instance of a recurring event instead of the event itself

options.name: timeZone
options.description: Time zone used in the response. The default is the time zone of the calendar.

properties.name: returnAll
properties.description: Whether to return all results or only up to a given limit

properties.name: limit
properties.description: Max number of results to return

properties.name: timeMin
properties.description: At least some part of the event must be after this time, use expression to set a date, or switch to fixed mode to choose date from widget

properties.name: timeMax
properties.description: At least some part of the event must be before this time, use expression to set a date, or switch to fixed mode to choose date from widget

properties.name: options
properties.description: At least some part of the event must be after this time, use expression to set a date, or switch to fixed mode to choose date from widget

options.name: timeMin
options.description: At least some part of the event must be after this time, use expression to set a date, or switch to fixed mode to choose date from widget

options.name: timeMax
options.description: At least some part of the event must be before this time, use expression to set a date, or switch to fixed mode to choose date from widget

options.name: singleEvents
options.description: Whether to expand recurring events into instances and only return single one-off events and instances of recurring events, but not the underlying recurring events themselves

options.name: fields
options.description: Specify fields to return, by default a predefined by Google set of commonly used fields would be returned. To return all fields, use '*', More info.

options.name: iCalUID
options.description: Specifies event ID in the iCalendar format to be included in the response

options.name: maxAttendees
options.description: The maximum number of attendees to include in the response. If there are more than the specified number of attendees, only the participant is returned.

options.name: orderBy
options.description: Order by the start date/time (ascending). This is only available when querying single events (i.e. the parameter singleEvents is True).

options.name: Start Time
options.description: Order by the start date/time (ascending). This is only available when querying single events (i.e. the parameter singleEvents is True).

options.name: Updated
options.description: Order by last modification time (ascending)

options.name: query
options.description: Free text search terms to find events that match these terms in any field, except for extended properties

options.name: recurringEventHandling
options.description: Return all instances of recurring event for specified time range

options.name: All Occurrences
options.description: Return all instances of recurring event for specified time range

options.name: First Occurrence
options.description: Return event with specified recurrence rule

options.name: Next Occurrence
options.description: Return next instance of recurring event

options.name: showDeleted
options.description: Whether to include deleted events (with status equals "cancelled") in the result

options.name: showHiddenInvitations
options.description: Whether to include hidden invitations in the result

options.name: timeZone
options.description: Time zone used in the response. The default is the time zone of the calendar.

options.name: updatedMin
options.description: Lower bound for an event's last modification time (as a RFC3339 timestamp) to filter by. When specified, entries deleted since this time will always be included regardless of showDeleted.

notices.name: useN8nTimeZone
notices.text: This node will use the time zone set in n8n’s settings, but you can override this in the workflow settings

notes.name: Notes
notes.description: Optional note to save with the node

notesInFlow.name: Display Note in Flow?
notesInFlow.description: If active, the note above will display in the flow as a subtitle

alwaysOutputData.name: Always Output Data
alwaysOutputData.description: If active, will output a single, empty item when the output would have been empty. Use to prevent the workflow finishing on this node

executeOnce.name: Execute Once
executeOnce.description: If active, the node executes only once, with data from the first item it receives

retryOnFail.name: Retry On Fail
retryOnFail.description: If active, the node tries to execute again when it fails

maxTries.name: Max. Tries
maxTries.description: Number of times to attempt to execute the node before failing the execution

waitBetweenTries.name: Wait Between Tries (ms)
waitBetweenTries.description: How long to wait between each attempt (in milliseconds)

onError.name: On Error
onError.description: Action to take when the node execution fails

options.name: Stop Workflow
options.description: Halt execution and fail workflow

options.name: Continue
options.description: Pass error message as item in regular output

options.name: Continue (using error output)
options.description: Pass item to an extra `error` output

settings.note: Executable nodes have both common and executable settings
